name: ABC
text:
Red Cross workers in Brazil walk down the street disinfecting a sidewalk in Nova Friburgo as cases of the novel coronavirus continue to rise.

Brazil has been hardest hit by the COVID-19 pandemic in Latin America. https://t.co/mYM18iaVsj https://t.co/PMIozidrrh

name: ABC
text: Microsoft becomes the third big tech company this week to say it won’t sell its facial recognition software to police, following similar moves by Amazon and IBM. https://t.co/polIYiud1A

name: ABC
text: NICK OF TIME: Security cameras capture the moment when a New Jersey police officer saves and EMT who was choking on food. https://t.co/33ps19fHB5 https://t.co/uh8JKrZnna

name: ABC
text: MORE: While the convention will still be held in Charlotte, North Carolina, from Aug. 24-27, the acceptance speech will now be held at the VyStar Veterans Memorial Arena in Jacksonville, which holds 15,000 people. https://t.co/ZdE6lKUGzo

name: ABC
text:
RNC Chair Ronna McDaniel: “We are thrilled to celebrate this momentous occasion in the great city of Jacksonville."

"Not only does Florida hold a special place in Pres. Trump’s heart as his home state, but it is crucial in the path to victory in 2020." https://t.co/ZdE6lKUGzo https://t.co/pPQISID5jI

name: ABC
text: The Louisville Metro Council unanimously passed Breonna's Law, outlawing "no-knock" warrants and requiring body cameras be turned on before and after every search. https://t.co/5ndGUTlaPc

name: ABC
text: Archaeologists discover what they believe to be one of the earliest playhouses in London, which may date back over 450 years ago. https://t.co/TI3wejzuAI

name: ABC
text: Tyson Foods shares fall after the company said it is cooperating with a federal investigation into price-fixing in the chicken industry. https://t.co/mzsQwnCdqy

name: ABC
text: Darrell "Bubba" Wallace Jr. says he's "really proud" of NASCAR for "stepping up" and banning the Confederate flag from all its events. https://t.co/tREdD7Yqfh https://t.co/LGQ6AA78Yi

name: ABC
text: The skies are clearing up a bit for airlines as states ease lockdown measures and travelers slowly return to airport check-in lines. https://t.co/v0J8XodK4F

name: ABC
text: German airline Lufthansa says 22,000 full-time jobs may need to be cut worldwide due to the drop in demand for flights caused by the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/ciaDbooeHQ

name: ABC
text: After facing scrutiny for discriminatory practices, Walmart is changing its policy of locking up beauty products marketed toward black people. https://t.co/YCKbb9VCVU

name: ABC
text: Advocates want to redirect police funding to community health, safety and economic programs, in an effort to develop new ways to address drug use, homelessness and other issues police are tasked with responding to in America. https://t.co/X20IKvGGxL

name: ABC
text: Meat production has rebounded from its low point during the coronavirus pandemic when dozens of plants were closed, but experts say consumer prices are likely to remain high and it will take months to work through a backlog of millions of pigs and cattle. https://t.co/Egy6evHAx3

name: ABC
text: "I believe that I can support the thin blue line just as much as I can support Black Lives Matter, but I can do it from my own platform." https://t.co/o74s3VT0aM

name: ABC
text:
SOUND ON: The sound of the Golden Gate Bridge 'singing' is heard across San Francisco bay.

An official said the effect was caused by new handrails which allowed air to move more freely. https://t.co/8ZHVZfw3G8 https://t.co/l3r7VLJNCK

name: ABC
text: Dancewear brand announces that it's making its pointe shoes more inclusive. https://t.co/JfKWQzsuSt

name: ABC
text: Breonna Taylor's mom Tamika Palmer tells @JujuChangABC she's still seeking answers nearly three months after her daughter's death: "I haven't had time to sit and grieve… I'm still trying to figure out, why did it have to come to her being murdered." https://t.co/DEp80bpzre https://t.co/3WZSkOiGic

name: ABC
text: Tulsa family wants charges dropped after teen arrested for jaywalking. https://t.co/fH2qD952u0

text: The largest nongovernmental supporter of cancer research in the U.S. is facing major financial hardship. https://t.co/v1Ak49AZW8

text: “I wanted to show my granddaughters Barbies are not just about the shoes.” https://t.co/WHmoJvCqvg

name: ABC
text: LAPD is investigating more than 50 instances of officer misconduct during protests over George Floyd's death and police brutality, according to Los Angeles Mayor Eric Garcetti. https://t.co/YoruemuTSl

name: ABC
text: The NYPD is investigating claims a 16-year-old Bronx student was zapped in the face with a stun gun and taken to the hospital without his family being notified after being arrested for allegedly setting fires. https://t.co/FtvD1WYoah

name: ABC
text: Under new rules, federal Swiss officials will have to take the train — not a plane — where available for work trips. https://t.co/hYibSDecYb

text:
"Masks can help, but it's masks plus physical separation."

Dr. Fauci voices concerns about coronavirus spreading amid nationwide protests. https://t.co/p9J2bGZen8

text: BREAKING: The U.K. economy shrank by a colossal 20.4% in April, the first full month that the country was in its coronavirus lockdown. https://t.co/mRIWmAKByQ https://t.co/uQ55laQAR6

name: ABC
text: Surgeons in Chicago give a new set of lungs to a young woman with severe lung damage from the coronavirus. https://t.co/qG4pj7jzrA

name: ABC
text: Vanessa Bryant reveals new tattoos in honor of her late husband and daughter, Kobe and Gianna Bryant. https://t.co/c6w9odgjfH

name: ABC
text:
Chaotic video captures clash between police and protesters in Miami, after officers responded to vandalism of a Ponce de Leon statue, leading to seven arrests.

Police said several officers were assaulted and a police vehicle damaged during the melee. https://t.co/jg0icCQsVB https://t.co/pUcKMakMbD

name: ABC
text: Former DEA spokesperson who posed as covert CIA operative pleads guilty in elaborate fraud scheme. https://t.co/kMZLtDCAy8

text: Sec. of State Mike Pompeo censures International Criminal Court after Pres. Trump authorized sanctions on ICC officials involved in investigating U.S. service members. https://t.co/HH0eCZcu6n

name: ABC
text: The task force set up to deal with COVID-19 assumes a diminished role, as Pres. Donald Trump and Vice Pres. Mike Pence openly shift into campaign mode. https://t.co/kG2UlHyWul

name: ABC
text:
"This is the equivalent to having Hitler's statue in a Jewish community."

In a debate on a Virginia street, protesters demanding a Confederate monument be removed explain how its symbolism harms their community, as others criticize its vandalism. https://t.co/3ldG3J3NbJ https://t.co/QZr1djRZ2l

name: ABC
text: Egypt will reopen select tourist destinations to international charter flights starting July 1, allowing travelers from around the world to return to parts of the country less hard-hit by the coronavirus. https://t.co/UQDMgUv8MR

name: ABC
text: Hundreds of Lebanese poured into the streets to protest the tumbling of the national currency to a new low against the dollar, blocking roads and highways across the country that had started slowly opening up after months of coronavirus restrictions. https://t.co/bhFR2OhLQ4

name: ABC
text: Former Jeffrey Epstein companion Ghislaine Maxwell seeks to keep court records under seal. https://t.co/XpboNWGyXE

text: Merriam-Webster will alter the definition of racism after a woman's letter prompted the change. https://t.co/eScjkS237A

name: ABC
text: The sad and twisted tale that ended in the killing of a former state senator and businesswoman in northeastern Arkansas is about to become a little more clear. https://t.co/437jwKQh27

name: ABC
text: Heavy rainfall around New Orleans flooded roads and partially submerged vehicles after a major storm blew through the region. https://t.co/swqLw8K5WJ https://t.co/BaWU69nli6

name: ABC
text:
JARRING SITUATION: Workers at an animal rescue center had to free an overly ambitious raccoon that got its head stuck in a grape jelly jar.

The furry food bandit appeared just fine, shaking it off after being freed. https://t.co/zk02iFrBld https://t.co/ySoKrqAsID

name: ABC
text: Minority-owned small businesses still struggle to access billions in stimulus. https://t.co/QtyDu6tyUX

name: ABC
text: 📸 Artists create a "Black Lives Matter" mural on Seattle’s E. Pine Street as protesters establish what they call an autonomous zone while protesting against racial inequality and calling for the defunding of Seattle police. https://t.co/96PEscIuzb https://t.co/Ph6VkRZHch

name: ABC
text:
"I missed that by 15 seconds!"

Powerful winds in Sandusky, Ohio, caused a partial roof collapse of a near-century-old theater, sending bricks and debris falling on to the street below moments after one man passed by. https://t.co/fG6j5JRKMX https://t.co/VpwWzKoAND

name: ABC
text: A three-foot-tall robot named Kennedy is among the innovate solutions businesses are employing to keep surfaces clean as they reopen in the coronavirus era. https://t.co/WO81AkNTko

name: ABC
text: "I care about coronavirus and I know that it's a real threat, but racism is, to me to my family, the bigger threat right now and it has been for hundreds of years." https://t.co/9Jit0GTzJL

name: ABC
text: While the risk of COVID-19 transmission during outdoor demonstrations is lower than it would be indoors, mass protests could still potentially spread the virus, health experts have warned. https://t.co/o0GoBod38W

name: ABC
text: 📸 A cardboard audience is seen in the stands as Karsten Warholm of Norway competes in Men's 300m Hurdles during the Impossible Games 2020 in the Bislett Stadium in Oslo, Norway. https://t.co/67ypSx77gK https://t.co/mgOTlXe2At

name: ABC
text: 📸 The statue of Robert Dundas is seen in Edinburgh, Scotland after it had been graffitied with 'son of slavery' and 'colonialist profiteer'. Activists have renewed calls to remove statues that honour historical figures with links to the slave trade. https://t.co/XdfqO9MCaI https://t.co/i0H4ATGWlU

name: ABC
text:
The downward movement in Pres. Trump's approval rating belies the notion that nothing matters when it comes to public opinion of this president.

For that reason, his reelection chances could now be in real danger. More, via @FiveThirtyEight: https://t.co/7hmDAP6IsS

text: A 23-year-old University of Connecticut student who allegedly killed two people and led police on a multi-state manhunt has been transported from Maryland back to Connecticut, authorities said. https://t.co/F5rZ7OVzaJ

text: "It is really important for us to begin collecting these stories, because as the country begins to open back up, a lot of those stories will be lost or forgotten." https://t.co/1lzRhQXmDe

text: MAGIC MOMENT: Visitors capture the moment a stingray gives birth in a Florida aquarium. https://t.co/QOlQLckqaj https://t.co/Gym12KcFOC

name: ABC
text:
Breonna Taylor was fatally shot by police executing a controversial "no-knock" search warrant while she was asleep in her Kentucky home back in March.

Her death has drawn national attention and calls for an outside investigation into the incident. https://t.co/k0DWk2laHs https://t.co/I7bHvG01yN

text: After confrontations with police, protesters in Seattle seized a several-block area to create an "autonomous police-free zone," and Seattle's police chief says she's "very angry about the situation." https://t.co/t9oq2831nA

text: TO THE RESCUE: Police in Germany relocated a family of ducks to a safer environment after they were spotted on a city street. https://t.co/g2L8Gt9hk6 https://t.co/EFlilAAmFK
